main event: A student observed a cigar-shaped object with a bluish extension flying from the northeast to the south in Santa Maria, California on 6 January 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as orange in color with a seemingly contradictory shape, both cigar-shaped and like a round ball., The object was estimated to be faster than a jet and flying at an altitude of 15,000 feet., The observation lasted for about 20 seconds., Binoculars were used for better visibility of the object., Several hypotheses were suggested regarding the object's identification, including balloon and aircraft.
sighted object: one cigar-shaped object with bluish extension
